channel.title: Wireless connection
channel.description:
I just installed the AOL free trial thing, but the only way I can connect to AOL is with my wireless connection, but the damn program wont let me.
can anyone help me???

item.title: Wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @Chimaera_God Chimaera God
item.description:
@Chimaera_God wrote:

The thing is that my sister has the same connection as I do, but when she installed the AOL thing, it connected to AOL without any problems. My sister says she doesn’t remember how she did it, so I’m confused…

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @nator123123 nator123123
item.description:
@nator123123 wrote:

Maybe you don’t have a WireLess connection. Go install torrent for Driver Genius Pro with keygen on that comp and on another computer that has intranetz.
run it on the no intrnetz comp
find the wierless network driver and copy the url to an interneted one, then install it on that one.
Then, on that intrnetz comp go install it, and activate it.
Go get a flash driver, such as SD card or MP3 PLAYER.
Run Driver Genius PRO, then do the following:
Update Drivers -> (YOUR OPERATING SYSTEM) -> Check anything that says Network Driver, ex, mine is (Atheros AR5xxx wireless network driver) -> For "Chose your place to save your drivers ", put the directory to the flash driver. -> Install!!

After you are done,

Read full topic

item.title: Wireless connection
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

You need a modem to use dial-up internet, a wireless connection will only work if there is a router connected to a modem on the other end.

Read full topic
